basics.name: Kenneth de Guzman
basics.label: VICEROY Scholar |B.S Computer Science | Interim Secret Clearance
basics.summary: Aloha! I am a B.S Computer Science graduate from the University of Hawaii at Mānoa with a background in full-stack development. I'm passionate in developing software solutions to solve problems for improving ease of use and eager to meaningfully contribute to mission-critical objectives.

skills.name: Frameworks & Databases
keywords: Next.js · React.js · Meteor.js · Bootstrap · Prisma ORM | PostgreSQL · MySQL

skills.name: DevOps & Project Practices
keywords: Git · GitHub · Docker · DigitalOcean | Issue-Driven Project Management · Agile Project Management · Kanban Board

education.institution: University of Hawaii at Mānoa, Honolulu, HI

highlights: Assigned to the Hawaii National Guard as a full-stack developer intern to design a software solution as a means of aggregating State and Federal sources of input into one consolidated platform for coordinating wildfire response efforts within a simple common operating picture

Collaborated in a team with data science and cybersecurity backgrounds, along with HING mentors to develop a web application tailored to improve the operational workflow at the JOC for emergency response allocation and assessing risk
Collaborated and planned a web app’s features based on a military command center’s needs for improved operational workflow in coordinating better response efforts for emergencies
Developed a web app using Node.js, Prisma ORM, PostgresSQL, Next.js, Bootstrap, CSS and TypeScript as a software solution for the HING JOC’s needs

Designed a system that allows for creating map markers to assess incident locations, viewing fire-related news within all counties in Hawaii, and a messages component for improving communication initiatives for synchronized coordination efforts
Deployed the app at https://hifirescenter.org/ using DigitalOcean as the IaaS provider

awards.title: Hawai'i Nikkei Historical Editorial Board
awards.summary: Awarded to students with outstanding research projects during the 2017 Hawai'i History Day State Fair.

awards.title: Mānoa Dean's List
awards.summary: Undergraduate students are awarded the Dean's List distinction if they earn a grade point average of 3.50 or higher during a semester with 12+ credits.

awards.title: Academic Honors, Summa Cum Laude
awards.summary: Honors Recognition Certificate awarded to students who achieved the requirements for a High School diploma with a cumulative GPA of 3.80 or higher.
